metadata.synopsis: Minsc at a party organized by Withers.Variants:Minsc's allied with Nine-Fingers state: The player convinced Minsc to see the nuance between good and evil and set aside his differences with the Guild to work with them. His version of this is being a corrective measure to them - he has dragged a Guild thief along to the party with him so he can observe 'real' heroes.Minsc base state: The player failed / didn't try to convince Minsc of this nuance, so he's back to his usual ways - getting way in over his head by utterly refusing to compromise. In this case, Withers portal found him while he was imprisoned in a Zhentarim stronghold awaiting execution. But he's not phased, because Minsc believes he can survive anything (and in this case, he probably can by sheer force of optimism/brute violence.)

61.speaker: Minsc
61.text: BOO! WE ARE NOT DREAMING! IT IS OUR OLD FRIEND!
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc throws his arms wide in greeting. NOTE: In this state, he is wearing rags / covered in grime / both.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: It's good to see you too, Minsc.
80.context: NodeContext: Gesturing to himself and his prison-garb

123.speaker: Minsc
123.text: And it is good to be seen! After so many days down in the dark, Minsc began to wonder if he was some blind bug who had only dreamed himself to be large and bulksome.
123.context: NodeContext: Gesturing to himself and his prison-garb

168.speaker: Minsc
168.text: You will forgive the aroma, I hope. We were not expecting the dusty one to open a portal to our very cell!
168.context: NodeContext: Gesturing to himself and his prison-garb

45.speaker: Minsc
45.text: Boo had a moment to lick himself clean, but there is a little too much of Minsc to cover.

304.speaker: Player
304.text: You were in a cell? What for?

148.speaker: Minsc
148.text: Minsc and Boo have been helping, of course! We guard the streets while Jaheira is occupied with Harperish matters.

169.speaker: Minsc
169.text: The Zhentarim rule the city's underbelly - so Minsc and Boo went to give them a tickle. There were harsh words. Battle-cries. Some manner of... head-wound?

63.speaker: Minsc
63.text: We awoke in a Zhentish cell, awaiting trial by noble combat! Ah - 'execution', says Boo, though... I am not sure of the difference?

178.speaker: Minsc
178.text: It is a long walk to the gallows and Minsc still has his fists, no?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: It sounds like Withers got you out just in time.

100.speaker: Minsc
100.text: In ample time indeed! So long as the bone-mage returns us to our cell by dawn. Boo would not be late to the bloodshed.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: You're going to get yourself killed - you can't fight everyone you disagree with.

265.speaker: Minsc
265.text: Minsc and Boo agree. To disagree.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: The Zhentarim are peace-keepers in the city now, Minsc. You have to live with that.

234.speaker: Minsc
234.text: The Zhent may keep their peace, so long as Minsc may keep his steel. We shall see which is the first to shatter, hm?

263.speaker: Player
263.text: Does Jaheira know you're off the leash?

91.speaker: Minsc
91.text: ...She told Minsc and Boo to behave themselves - which is why we shall be back in our cell by dawn.

97.speaker: Minsc
97.text: But leave such matters for the morn! Tonight is for celebration, and telling of tales!

108.speaker: Minsc
108.text: How have you filled your days, since we tore the sticky tyrant from the sky?

219.speaker: Player
219.text: Just living my life - now I've found someone to live it with.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: I've been happily putting all of this behind me.

98.speaker: Minsc
98.text: Bah, Boo does not believe your bitter words!

299.speaker: Player
299.text: Finding more adventure wherever I can. Without any tadpoles this time, thankfully.

243.speaker: Minsc
243.text: He has developed something of a taste for tadpole, and is displeased by the diet I have placed him on. But no better cure than the company of friends!

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Honestly? I've been missing all of you.

2.speaker: Minsc
2.text: No no, my friend! It is not yet time for tears, and passing Boo around for the wiping of eyes!

191.speaker: Minsc
191.text: There is much merriment to be made before the night is done. Go, and greet the others - Minsc shall make himself presentable.

92.speaker: Minsc
92.text: This pond shall do nicely, Boo. Though I see no soap - so you shall have to blow the bubbles for me...

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I've been enjoying life. Throwing parties, making connections. And watching my old friends, biding my time...

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I've been enjoying life. Throwing parties, making connections, slowly amassing power...

177.speaker: Player
177.text: I've been seeing the world - finally living my life on my terms.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: I killed Cazador with the help of some friends. I'm finally free!

208.speaker: Player
208.text: I finally faced Cazador. It wasn't easy, but he's dead. After all these years, I'm free.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: I was searching for a way to walk in the sun again. No luck yet, but I won't give up.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: I stuck with the adventurer's life - killing monsters is a lot of fun.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I found the other spawn in the Underdark. We're building a new home down there.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: I've been seeing the world. And hiding from Cazador...

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I've been with Astarion - trying to find a way to cure him.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I've been in Baldur's Gate, spreading Lady Shar's teachings. Her church is thriving.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: I've been free to do as I please for the first time ever: travelling, adventuring, getting to know... well, myself, I suppose.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I have a little cottage now - it's close to my parents and has room for all the animals I've taken in.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I have a little cottage now - it's close to my parents, and has room for all the animals I've taken in.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I've just been trying to live my life, away from Shar's shadow. Isn't always easy, but I'm managing.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: I've been in the Hells with Karlach, fighting off devils and looking for a cure for her heart.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: I've been staying alive in Avernus - barely. Hoping for a cure for this heart soon, though.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I've devoted myself to the hunt. The Sword Coast must be cleansed of its monsters.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I've devoted myself to rebuilding the city. A life of diplomacy and difficult bargains.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I hunt the Hells, ridding them of any beast that has set its eyes on the Sword Coast.

267.speaker: Player
267.text: I've devoted myself to the hunt. The Sword Coast must be cleansed of its monsters.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: Lae'zel and I have been fighting for the lich queen - the Prince of the Comet shall soon fall.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Lae'zel and I have been fighting for the Comet Prince - the lich queen shall soon fall.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: I am on the verge of recruiting a powerful ally. The Comet will soon crush the lich queen.

252.speaker: Player
252.text: Vlaakith's assassin's still hound me, and I soak the ground with their blood.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: I've spread my wings since we last met. Got a few more spells in my arsenal, a few more miles under my boots...

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I returned to Waterdeep a better wizard than I left it. Now, I read, I write, I do a spot of teaching...

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I claimed the Crown of Karsus, became the god of ambition and established my new domain in Elysium.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: I take joy in peaceful routine - I've gotten good at draconic tea ceremonies.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I've studied Bhaalian history - if you've got any more allies from the last Crisis, I'd like to meet them.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Now I'm cured, I'm just like any old Baldurian. Nothing special, and glad of it.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Who cares? Give me a bloody hug.

269.speaker: Player
269.text: I'm not sure I even want to know what you've been up to.

248.speaker: Minsc
248.text: What else but the stuff of songs, my friend?

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You couldn't have tidied yourself up a bit for the celebration?

183.speaker: Minsc
183.text: I come clothed in blood, sweat and the tears of my foes! What better attire for a hero?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: What happened to you? You look terrible.
69.context: NodeContext: Mild reproach at the player not saying hello

315.speaker: Minsc
315.text: Boo suggests that a 'hello' is more traditional.
315.context: NodeContext: Mild reproach at the player not saying hello

257.speaker: Minsc
257.text: What is reuniting with old comrades, if not the stuff of dreams? But Minsc is full-clothed, so this must be no vision!

78.speaker: Minsc
78.text: We shall conclude our business with the thief - but have no fear, my friend.
78.context: NodeContext: Big breath of freshh air, surveying our old campsite

181.speaker: Minsc
181.text: Boo will save you a dance.

146.speaker: Minsc
146.text: Breathe deep, Boo! The smell of hero sings from every stone in this place!
146.context: NodeContext: Big breath of freshh air, surveying our old campsite

213.speaker: Minsc
213.text: Breathe deep, Boo! The smell of hero sings from every stone in this place!
213.context: NodeContext: Big breath of freshh air, surveying our old campsite

0.speaker: Minsc
0.text: To meet again where your journey began, my friend - an honour. For Minsc and his hamster both.
0.context: NodeContext: Warm, his first time seeing us in months

281.speaker: Minsc
281.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc steps aside to reveal a halfling - wide-eyed and wheezing in terror.NodeContext: As if just remembering - stepping aside to reveal the hapless Guiild thief that was dragged along with him

223.speaker: Minsc
223.text: Happy...? Where did the little halfling go, Boo?
223.context: NodeContext: Turning to introduce Happy, realising he's not there

228.speaker: Happy Hoarson
228.context: NodeContext: Frightened, trying to keep your cool and play along - a little out of breath as you've just been dragged through a portal to who knows where by Minsc.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: It's good to see you too. And this 'Happy' is...?
129.context: NodeContext: Just realizing Happy isn't around (edge-case)

158.speaker: Minsc
158.text: Soon to be very unhappy, for he has slipped Boo's leash once more. Perhaps he was too shy to meet you.
158.context: NodeContext: Just realizing Happy isn't around (edge-case)

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Withers didn't say we could bring guests.
115.context: NodeContext: Breathless, realising player might be his sane saviour from Minsc

87.speaker: Minsc
87.text: He is not a guest, but your newest follower!
87.context: NodeContext: Breathless, realising player might be his sane saviour from Minsc

312.speaker: Minsc
312.text: Granted, Happy dangled upside-down from my fist. Minsc caught him - a Guild sneak-thief, sifting through the rubble!

77.speaker: Minsc
77.text: When the portal appeared, Minsc was so startled that he dropped the halfling through. Perhaps this is why he has grown dizzy, and wandered off...

127.speaker: Minsc
127.text: It is just this day that Happy learned of your legend - while we gazed down upon the very city you saved.
127.context: NodeContext: Breathless, realising player might be his sane saviour from Minsc

65.speaker: Happy Hoarson
65.text: He d-dangled me from the High Hall. Upside-down. For two hours.
65.context: NodeContext: Breathless, realising player might be his sane saviour from Minsc

153.speaker: Minsc
153.text: The Guild should not go creeping in high places if they do not have the stomach for them, hm?

85.speaker: Minsc
85.text: It is well for Happy the strange portal appeared when it did. Minsc's arm was growing achesome.
85.context: NodeContext: Left in doubt as to whether he's teasing Happy or serious

43.speaker: Player
43.text: You're still chasing after the Guild? I thought you'd made your peace with them.

51.speaker: Minsc
51.text: So I have! Though it is a peace made more from blade and boot than it is any sense of brotherhood.

251.speaker: Minsc
251.text: Nine-Fingers forbade any looting of the illithid's fleshy vessels - and so Minsc guards what remains of the battle-site, even from her.

196.speaker: Minsc
196.text: But, where Minsc might once have thrown any sneaking scoundrels from the tower-top... now, I tell them of you. How you ruled the wickedness within. How they might do the same.

180.speaker: Happy Hoarson
180.text: Yes! Yes, I'll rule it! I'll be better!

273.speaker: Minsc
273.text: Though, of course - it is still for Boo to decide if they live or die.
273.context: NodeContext: Bursting Happy's hopes that Minsc might show mercy - it's really out of his hands.

131.speaker: Happy Hoarson
131.context: NodeContext: Mute horror - dawning realization that your fate will be decided my  a madman's hamster

187.speaker: Minsc
187.text: But enough, my friend! I cannot tell your tale if I do not know the whole of it! Minsc and Boo would know where you have been - what you have done.
187.context: NodeContext: Cheerily oblivious to Happy's life-or-death terror, more interested in catching up with us

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I've been enjoying life. Throwing parties, making connections. And watching my old friends, biding my time...
3.context: NodeContext: as in 'hope you haven't been feasting on people'

113.speaker: Minsc
113.text: Boo thinks you are grown swollen on your own importance, bloodsucker. Mind you do not give him cause to go a-squishing, yes?

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I've been enjoying life. Throwing parties, making connections, slowly amassing power...
68.context: NodeContext: as in 'hope you haven't been feasting on people'

302.speaker: Minsc
302.text: Incorrect. For Boo is most powerful, and Minsc is most massful - and we have received no invitation to any such parties.

176.speaker: Minsc
176.text: Take care, lordling. Boo allowed you to ascend in the hope it would make a hero of you. And heroes invite other heroes to their fanciful get-togethers.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I've been seeing the world - finally living my life on my terms.
53.context: NodeContext: as in 'hope you haven't been feasting on people'

289.speaker: Minsc
289.text: I hope it has been a feast for your eyes! And only your eyes, friend Astarion.
289.context: NodeContext: as in 'hope you haven't been feasting on people'

186.speaker: Player
186.text: I killed Cazador with the help of some friends. I'm finally free!
186.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

22.speaker: Minsc
22.text: Boo and I toasted your victory when we heard! If you could have seen his tiny paws clasping his thimble of ale, you would have been double-pleased, old friend.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: I finally faced Cazador. It wasn't easy, but he's dead. After all these years, I'm free.
201.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I was searching for a way to walk in the sun again. No luck yet, but I won't give up.
72.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

290.speaker: Minsc
290.text: I don't know much, old friend, but I do know this: What Astarion wants, Astarion gets.

42.speaker: Minsc
42.text: Except for those many covetous glances you once threw at Boo.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I stuck with the adventurer's life - killing monsters is a lot of fun.
105.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

116.speaker: Minsc
116.text: Did you hear that, Boo? Minsc has won the wager!

254.speaker: Minsc
254.text: My hamster thought you might stray from the path, but Minsc always bets upon his friends. Keep it up, and Boo will have ne'er a coin left in his little cheeks!

205.speaker: Player
205.text: I found the other spawn in the Underdark. We're building a new home down there.
205.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I've been seeing the world. And hiding from Cazador...
32.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

17.speaker: Minsc
17.text: He still lives? A dark blotch upon our banquet-cloth this night. One we must patch until it is all hamster hair and heroism!

139.speaker: Minsc
139.text: We shall aid you, friend vampire. Tonight for the dancing and the dining, and tomorrow for the dark lord's just desserts.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I've been with Astarion - trying to find a way to cure him.
143.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

81.speaker: Minsc
81.text: A powerful pairing. If love cannot cure a vampire, what can?
81.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

198.speaker: Minsc
198.text: Oh. Boo suggests a variety of arcane remedies. But love - love is the most potent! And by far the easiest to pronounce.
198.context: NodeContext: Listens to squeaks at start of node.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I've been in the Hells with Karlach, fighting off devils and looking for a cure for her heart.
46.context: NodeContext: Boo supplies the answer to his question at the start, Minsc turns to player by the end - could be Karlach OR default player

193.speaker: Minsc
193.text: Oh Boo, do you know what it would mean - to find a cure for Karlach's heart?
193.context: NodeContext: Boo supplies the answer to his question at the start, Minsc turns to player by the end - could be Karlach OR default player

242.speaker: Minsc
242.text: Exactly! Her heart would be cured! When this day comes, you must come and bunk with Minsc and Boo.
242.context: NodeContext: Boo supplies the answer to his question at the start, Minsc turns to player by the end - could be Karlach OR default player

256.speaker: Minsc
256.text: Fear not, we sleep in that sewer no longer. It is a different sewer - much less damp beneath the bedroll.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: I've been in Baldur's Gate, spreading Lady Shar's teachings. Her church is thriving.
200.context: NodeContext: Cheering himself up, having just considered prospect of one day fight Shadowheart.

239.speaker: Minsc
239.text: Spreading her infection, you mean. Lady Loss is like a wound left to rot - and the day may come when Minsc and Boo must scratch.
239.context: NodeContext: Cheering himself up, having just considered prospect of one day fight Shadowheart.

109.speaker: Minsc
109.text: But it is this night still - and a night for celebration, no less!
109.context: NodeContext: Cheering himself up, having just considered prospect of one day fight Shadowheart.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: I've been free to do as I please for the first time ever: travelling, adventuring, getting to know... well, myself, I suppose.
250.context: NodeContext: Minsc telling Shadowheart about Shadowheart, after she said she's been 'getting to know herself'

244.speaker: Minsc
244.text: Minsc has known Shadowheart for some time, and so feels permitted to say - getting to know her is a rocky road, but one well worth the walking.
244.context: NodeContext: Minsc telling Shadowheart about Shadowheart, after she said she's been 'getting to know herself'

294.speaker: Player
294.text: I have a little cottage now - it's close to my parents and has room for all the animals I've taken in.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I have a little cottage now - it's close to my parents, and has room for all the animals I've taken in.

227.speaker: Minsc
227.text: Minsc would not presume to ask if any miniature giant space hamsters have joined your menagerie. You would have mentioned by now if a friend for Boo were found.

245.speaker: Minsc
245.text: But in case that should change, remember: Minsc has two shoulders.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I've just been trying to live my life, away from Shar's shadow. Isn't always easy, but I'm managing.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I've been staying alive in Avernus - barely. Hoping for a cure for this heart soon, though.

119.speaker: Minsc
119.text: A cure for your heart! Karlach, do you know what this means? Soon, your heart will be cured!

240.speaker: Minsc
240.text: When this day comes, you must come and bunk with Minsc and Boo!

217.speaker: Player
217.text: I've devoted myself to the hunt. The Sword Coast must be cleansed of its monsters.
217.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

41.speaker: Minsc
41.text: Minsc shares in your mission, friend - you pursue fiends from outside the city's walls, and Minsc will rout them from within.

220.speaker: Minsc
220.text: Like two brawnsome vipers we will be, striking at the heel and head of villainy!

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I've devoted myself to rebuilding the city. A life of diplomacy and compromise.
138.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

20.speaker: Minsc
20.text: Compromise! Like when Boo wants to himself a turkey leg entire, and Minsc must be content with a hamster-sized wing instead.

179.speaker: Minsc
179.text: You have a better head for such things than most, old friend. May Baldur's Gate flow over with fried poultry under your reign!

274.speaker: Player
274.text: I've been hunting the Hells, ridding them of any beast that has set its eyes on the Sword Coast.
274.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

275.speaker: Minsc
275.text: As Minsc hunts the fiends inside the city walls, so does Wyll hunt the devils outside them! Let us meet in the middle for a hearty toast before long - Boo's treat!

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I've devoted myself to the hunt. The Sword Coast must be cleansed of its monsters.
49.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

266.speaker: Player
266.text: Lae'zel and I have been fighting for the lich queen - the Prince of the Comet shall soon fall.
266.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Lae'zel and I have been fighting for the Comet Prince - the lich queen shall soon fall.
31.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

197.speaker: Minsc
197.text: Minsc hears the determination rattle your cry, even if he can't remember who is the Comet and who the lich queen.

202.speaker: Minsc
202.text: Boo will remind him of the details later - he has the memory of a miniature giant space elephant.

293.speaker: Player
293.text: I've been fighting, recruiting - and gained powerful allies. The Comet will soon crush the lich queen.
293.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

117.speaker: Player
117.text: I've soaked the ground with the blood of Vlaakith's deadliest assassins.
117.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

214.speaker: Minsc
214.text: Silly Vlaakith! What would one undying know about the dealing of death?

204.speaker: Minsc
204.text: Boo thinks you will not be long in reminding her how to die, hm?

282.speaker: Player
282.text: I've spread my wings since we last met. Got a few more spells in my arsenal, a few more miles under my boots...
282.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

184.speaker: Minsc
184.text: Keep a close guard on that ambition, friend wizard, and do not spread those wings too wide.

4.speaker: Minsc
4.text: Even the softest of boot leather can betray the overzealous adventurer. My toes know all too well - Boo can attest to much ignoble squealing around campfires past.

272.speaker: Player
272.text: I returned to Waterdeep a better wizard than I left it. Now, I read, I write, I do a spot of teaching...
272.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

190.speaker: Minsc
190.text: Ah, and you wish Minsc to come and tell your students of the adventurer's road? An honour!
190.context: NodeContext: Cutting Gale's mention of being a teacher off, immediately assuming it to be an invite

170.speaker: Minsc
170.text: One Minsc will refuse. To be trapped in a room full of fresh-faced wizards... no. Better that Boo does it.

225.speaker: Minsc
225.text: We shall discuss his fee once our fun is had this night, hm?

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I claimed the Crown of Karsus, became the god of ambition and established my new domain in Elysium.
71.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully unimpressed with Gale's tales of becoming a god.

163.speaker: Minsc
163.text: And yet you still make it sound so boring. Truly, God-Gale, Minsc is glad to see you have not changed one bit!
163.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully unimpressed with Gale's tales of becoming a god.

218.speaker: Minsc
218.text: But I ask - should Boo send you prayers, answer not.  For his ambitions to be realised... the world is not ready for such things.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I take joy in peaceful routine - tea ceremonies, that kind of thing.

287.speaker: Minsc
287.text: Ah, Minsc knows these rituals well! He had to give them up on meeting Boo - there is only so much hamster hair one man can swallow.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I've studied Bhaalian history - if you've got any more allies from the last Crisis, I'd like to meet them.

35.speaker: Minsc
35.text: Minsc has wondered how that sad-mouthed Graycloak and flighty Aerie have fared. And whether Jan ever built his turnip-cannon.

59.speaker: Minsc
59.text: But should you meet a Red Wizard, remember - you may have conquered your bloodline, but there is no shame in a small and sensible amount of murder.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Now I'm cured, I'm just like any old Baldurian. Nothing special, and glad of it.
165.context: NodeContext: Hint of warning - he might take actual offense.

160.speaker: Minsc
160.text: Nothing special!? If that is so, then Boo is naught but a brown and base rodent.
160.context: NodeContext: Hint of warning - he might take actual offense.

9.speaker: Minsc
9.text: And I know that this is not what you are saying, my friend.
9.context: NodeContext: Hint of warning - he might take actual offense.

297.speaker: Player
297.text: Who cares? Give me a bloody hug.
297.context: NodeContext: Booming enthusiasm - thought player would never ask

1.speaker: Minsc
1.context: NodeContext: Booming enthusiasm - thought player would never ask

28.speaker: Minsc
28.text: And should you feel a squirming, know that it is only Boo. Or perhaps the buffet has gone bad.
28.context: NodeContext: Brief aside warning before continuing to pick player up in bear hug

210.speaker: Minsc
210.text: And now for the telling of tales, yes?
210.context: NodeContext: Minsc steps forward and grabs the player up in a bear hug. Ideally hoisting so that all player races have their head at the same height - so that Boo can briefly jump on top of it.

6.speaker: Minsc
6.text: And now for the telling of tales, yes?
6.context: NodeContext: Minsc steps forward and grabs the player up in a bear hug. Ideally hoisting so that all player races have their head at the same height - so that Boo can briefly jump on top of it.

285.speaker: Minsc
285.text: And now for the telling of tales, yes?
285.context: NodeContext: Minsc steps forward and grabs the player up in a bear hug. Ideally hoisting so that all player races have their head at the same height - so that Boo can briefly jump on top of it.

152.speaker: Minsc
152.text: And now for the telling of tales, yes?
152.context: NodeContext: Minsc steps forward and grabs the player up in a bear hug. Ideally hoisting so that all player races have their head at the same height - so that Boo can briefly jump on top of it.

18.text: And now for the telling of tales, yes?
18.context: NodeContext: Minsc steps forward and grabs the player up in a bear hug. Ideally hoisting so that all player races have their head at the same height - so that Boo can briefly jump on top of it.

308.speaker: Minsc
308.text: And now for the telling of tales, yes?
308.context: NodeContext: Has set player back down, back on topic.

111.speaker: Minsc
111.text: Hah, you are quite coated in hamster-hair! Now wherever you go, Boo goes too.
111.context: NodeContext: Jovial, has just hugged player and passed on some of the hamster hair he's covered in.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: I've found a new life since my transformation - one different than I expected, but not lesser.
268.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

24.speaker: Minsc
24.text: Boo has been admiring the sheen of goo upon your slimely form. He says it twinkles in the starlight.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

86.speaker: Minsc
86.text: First I must find the sneak-thief, and educate him on the company he keeps.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

259.speaker: Minsc
259.text: Now, halfling. Boo will not have you embarrassing him in front of his friends - so you ought to know the rest of the company you keep.
259.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

238.speaker: Minsc
238.text: Wyll Ravengard, the Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate! A true leader, and a fine hero still - despite all his talk of taxes.
238.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

222.speaker: Minsc
222.text: Wyll Ravengard, Blade of Avernus! The name does not do him justice - hell fears his arrows, fists and well-placed kicks, also.
222.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

38.speaker: Minsc
38.text: Wyll Ravengard, the Blade of Frontiers, and bane of evil backsides!
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

261.speaker: Minsc
261.text: Lae'zel, of Creche Killer! True Child of Gith and true friend to Boo - though she will 'CHK!' and say it is not so.
261.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

206.speaker: Minsc
206.text: Astarion, who is banished by the sun itself for fear his spawnish soul might outshine it!
206.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

161.speaker: Minsc
161.text: (We visit with him much down in the dark places, though he often moves his lair without remembering to tell Minsc where.)
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot insteadNodeContext: Breaking his stream of pronouncements for a whispered aside.

122.speaker: Minsc
122.text: Gale, the-man-who-would-be-a-god, but-then-thought-better-of-it! Boo thinks better of him for it, too.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

64.speaker: Minsc
64.text: Shadowheart! Two gods tugged at her soul, but she managed to keep it for all herself in the end. Wait, Boo - did she do something with her hair...?
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

270.speaker: Minsc
270.text: Halsin, Archdruid of Arch...somewhere. He is a much better man than he smells.
270.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

29.speaker: Minsc
29.text: And there - the champion of... having tentacles! Karlach! (She once was very tall and strong, like Minsc, but we still like her as she is.)
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

157.speaker: Minsc
157.text: And... finally, Jaheira. If this is a name you do not already know, then not even Boo can save you.
157.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

316.speaker: Minsc
316.text: And there - the champion of the Hells herself. Karlach Demonsbane! Devilsbane! Myrkul-, Bhaal- and Bane-bane!
316.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

258.speaker: Minsc
258.text: Once the Guild is made of goodness once more, Boo shall scratch the hells wide open and find a way to bring her back!
258.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

246.speaker: Minsc
246.text: And there is... an absence. Karlach, who would have been the heart of this celebration, had she not lost her heart in turn.
246.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

25.speaker: Minsc
25.text: Saving your city was her last act in this life. Which is why Minsc will make sure the Guild honours her, yes?

301.speaker: Minsc
301.text: I hope you were listening, Happy! Boo says there will be a test!
301.context: NodeContext: Shouting a warning to the air, knowing Happy can hear him somewhere

150.speaker: Minsc
150.text: Study them well, sneak-thief - for the best among them will be a guide for your Guild. Heroes, who put the city before themselves. Who never falter in their duty. And, more than this...

114.speaker: Minsc
114.text: Who never arrive to a party without even a gift for the host.
114.context: NodeContext: Even more stern - considers this Happy's worst sin of all

284.speaker: Happy Hoarson
284.context: NodeContext: Scrambling, confused - Minsc is blaming you for something that is entirely Minsc's fault (cut off)

154.speaker: Minsc
154.text: Go, my friend. Be among our friends - there is much work yet to be done before this one is fit to join them.
154.context: NodeContext: to player, shaking his head at how much Happy has to learn

195.speaker: Minsc
195.text: And Minthara. Yes. She is here, also. Repenting of her wicked ways and performing charitable acts, no doubt!
195.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

314.speaker: Minsc
314.text: Shadowheart, foul Sharran. Trust no woman who makes an enemy of the moon.
314.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

37.speaker: Minsc
37.text: Gale, who now names himself a god. Though in truth - Minsc has known few wizards who did not think of themselves so.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

286.speaker: Minsc
286.text: Gale, the man-who-would-be-god, but chose-to-die-a-hero-instead. This smiling shimmering thing is but a poor copy, sent to ease our aching hearts.
286.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

298.speaker: Minsc
298.text: Lord Astarion, as murderous a monster as any I've known. But you are safe from his teeth - he is unlikely to stoop and split those fine trousers of his.
298.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot instead

199.speaker: Minsc
199.text: Wyll Ravengard, the Blade of Frontiers. Devil-horned, and angel-hearted!
199.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ideally a shot of the companion in quesiton, but if multiple speakers leads to fidelity issues, we can Minsc gesture at them out-of-shot insteadNodeContext: Pronouncing his companion's deeds (good or ill) to Happy

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Just living my life - now I've found someone to live it with.
88.context: NodeContext: Boo squeaking midway through, Minsc abashed

303.speaker: Minsc
303.text: Aha, the lovebirds still nest together, then? Minsc is glad - for what is life without a companion?
303.context: NodeContext: Boo squeaking midway through, Minsc abashed

283.speaker: Minsc
283.text: Though I am thinking yours does not sit on your shoulders, eh? Ah, you are right Boo! That is... none of Minsc's business.
283.context: NodeContext: Boo squeaking midway through, Minsc abashed

317.speaker: Player
317.text: Happily putting all of this behind me.
317.context: NodeContext: Responding to Boo's squeak of excitement at the mention of tadpoles - he's been eating too many, and Minsc is trying to wean him off

23.speaker: Minsc
23.text: Bah, Boo does not believe your bitter words!

292.speaker: Minsc
292.text: You stepped through the dusty one's portal willingly enough, no? And without Minsc even there to toss you!

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Finding more adventure where I can. Without any tadpoles this time, thankfully.
44.context: NodeContext: Responding to Boo's squeak of excitement at the mention of tadpoles - he's been eating too many, and Minsc is trying to wean him off

56.speaker: Minsc
56.text: 'WITHOUT' tadpoles, Boo! Forgive my hamster's squirrelishness.
56.context: NodeContext: Responding to Boo's squeak of excitement at the mention of tadpoles - he's been eating too many, and Minsc is trying to wean him off

33.speaker: Minsc
33.text: He has developed something of a taste for tadpole, and is displeased with the diet I have been forced to place him on.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Honestly? I've been missing all of you, mostly.

67.speaker: Minsc
67.text: No no, my friend, do not begin this! It is too early in the evening for tears, and passing Boo around for the blowing of noses.

104.speaker: Minsc
104.text: No no, my friend, do not begin this! It is too early in the evening for tears, and passing Boo around for the blowing of noses.

14.speaker: Minsc
14.text: First, I must educate this sneak-thief on the company he keeps.

310.speaker: Player
310.text: I'm glad you came. It has been too long.

73.speaker: Minsc
73.text: That it has! Minsc once idled away a century in stone, but he and Boo have been busy in these months since we parted.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: What have you been up to?

140.speaker: Minsc
140.text: Up...? Most recently, a long and winding stairway - to the High Hall!

48.speaker: Player
48.text: It's good to see you, Minsc. Boo too. And Happy...?
48.context: NodeContext: Stuttering, terrified gasp - not sure what to say

137.speaker: Minsc
137.text: Hah! See how your very presence snatches the breath from his chest? And it is no wonder!

54.speaker: Player
54.context: NodeContext: Stuttering, terrified gasp - not sure what to say

74.speaker: Happy Hoarson
74.context: NodeContext: Stuttering, terrified gasp - not sure what to say

305.speaker: Minsc
305.text: You have been keeping busy! Boo is glad to hear a hero of your calibre has not been sitting idle.

311.speaker: Minsc
311.text: You have been keeping busy! Boo is glad to hear a hero of your calibre has not been sitting idle.

128.speaker: Minsc
128.text: You have been keeping busy! Boo is glad to hear a hero of your calibre has not been sitting idle - or alone.

30.speaker: Minsc
30.text: Your troubles have been many. But Boo believes choppy seas make a skilled  sailor. It is why he requires Minsc to swim in the Sea of Swords each day at dawn!

11.speaker: Minsc
11.text: Your troubles have been many. But Boo believes choppy seas make a skilled swimmer especially when you have a paddle-mate at your side!

307.speaker: Minsc
307.text: Away, my friend! Minsc shall soon strip, and Boo would not see you blinded.
307.context: NodeContext: Jovial - he's about to go jump in the lake to clean himself
